page.title: 14RECREATION IN CHIRNSIDE
page.content: In Chirnside there are many parks, play areas and clubs. Berwickshire District Council looks after the parks and play areas. When new play equipment is needed the Common Good Association has fun runs and other activities to raise money for the equipment. The Common Good organises the old folks' trips. These trips have been going on for over 12 years. For the ladies in Chirnside there are the Wednesday Club, the Woman's Guild and the Women's Rural Institute. The WRI was founded in 1919 and is the oldest WRI in Berwickshire. The Guild and the WRI meet once a month, and the Wednesday Club once a fortnight. The Keep Fit Club and the Royal Scottish Country Dance Society meet every week in the school, and there are Sequence Dancing classes in the local hotel.
